meanings.definition: To identify too closely with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overidentify with her favorite characters in books.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overidentify with celebrities, as they may not always be good role models.
meanings.sent3: When she started to overidentify with her pet cat, she even started meowing in response to questions!
meanings.sent4: He tends to overidentify with his car, treating it like a member of the family.
meanings.sent5: The young girl's tendency to overidentify with her dolls made her room look like a tiny dollhouse.

meanings.definition: To attribute too much importance or significance to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He would often overidentify his success with luck rather than hard work.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overidentify a person's worth with their material possessions.
meanings.sent3: She overidentified her new haircut with a complete transformation of her life.
meanings.sent4: The artist overidentified his latest painting with a masterpiece, but critics disagreed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to overidentify a single test score with their overall intelligence.
